website_summaries.verdict: Worth considering for all you get at the reasonable price, especially if you're looking for an alternative to lever-operated models.
pros: A complete system that's easy to install and stands out for its push-button dispensing unit
Produces very hot water in seconds
cons: Occasional leaks have been reported, and it's noisier than some of its competitors

customer_reviews.title: But it is a stupid design flaw
customer_reviews.text: I won't live without one of these ever again. I have installed one in my last two houses and you will use this more than you think. There is one flaw in this unit. When you push the button down for hot water it would often stick in the down position and water would continue to run.The problem is the o-ring around button. it's too fat and it hinders button movement. I took it off and solved the problem. But it is a stupid design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy the push-button version
customer_reviews.text: Bought this during a Fall 2016 kitchen remodeling project. We LOVE the instant hot overall - had an earlier version forever. However in THIS model the little push-button would get stuck in “on” position. Started with just dripping, then stream, and eventually full on flow. We had to turn off water to the unit. Replacing with on with a different type of on/off mechanism, but have been living without for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa VanArsdel

customer_reviews.title: ALERT - Button sticks in the ON position..  DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: This product was working great for 2 months, but now that button is sticking. It will not turn off without having to jiggle it for several minutes. We have tried lubricating it with both silicon lubricant and WD40. No luck. Unfortunately we are outside the return windows, so not happy at all!
customer_reviews.author: Serena Soccer Mom

customer_reviews.title: Terrible! Won't turn off!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this model. The button gets stuck and the hot water won't turn off! how do we fix this I already paid to have it installed?
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this unit a year ago to replace one we had for 8 years. The system works as billed. Water is super hot. We had to get a plumber to install, and it didn’t take long at all. Maybe an hour to remove the old one and replace it. But here’s the issue, the little push button started to stick at about 6 months in. I read how to repair this and I did it. It started sticking intermittently again in June of this year. Now it sticks every time we use it. I like having instant hot water, but I’m changing this one and would not recommend buying this plunger type at all.
customer_reviews.author: Go Iowa State!

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: The installation went fine. I also installed a water filter. The unit worked well for about four months, with the exception of periodic sticking of the dispenser button. It happened more often, then it stuck in the on position. I took it apart to clean the button and lubricate the o-ring. No luck. Based on someone else’s review, I just removed the o-ring. With the number of complaints about the button in the reviews, this is a clear design flaw. I am moving to a new home on a few months and will not purchase this again, though I will be installing a hot water dispenser.
customer_reviews.author: Craig D. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: I've had three Insinkerators dispensers...
customer_reviews.text: I have had three different Insinkerator hot water dispensers all different models. These seem to have a lifespan of around 3-4 years before starting to leak. There isnt much of an alternative on the market. Insinkerator replaced the first one for free. The finish is very nice on this one and very easy to install. If you havent ever used a hot water dispenser, I would recommend this one as it is so nice to have hot water on demand.
customer_reviews.author: James B

customer_reviews.title: Unit is now useless.
customer_reviews.text: Unit stopped working less than 90 days. Top on/off button stuck in the down position and will not release and unable to stop hot water from coming out. Had to shut water supply to the unit from under the sink and disconnect power supply. Unit is now useless.
customer_reviews.author: Merilyn Gennaro

customer_reviews.title: Greta hot water tap. Perfect except the odd pricing.
customer_reviews.text: It's been in under our sink for around a month and still running great. I am disappointed though as we didn't get the brushed Nickel version. It was $100 more and that just seems ridiculous to charge that much more for the same exact product just based on demand at the time. The product itself is perfect though and is running like a champ. If it fails I will update but I don't know how we lived without the hot water tap for as long as we did.
customer_reviews.author: Biggitty Bam

customer_reviews.title: Water smells and tastes funny
customer_reviews.text: The water has a chemical taste and smell, and the tank makes the cabinet in which it is installed smell like glue or plastic. InSinkErator sent me a replacement, but the water also smelled and tasted funny. Waiting to see if the problem would resolve itself was a mistake because the problem did not go away, and the return policy for amazon is only a couple of weeks. InSinkErator has no refund policy, so I am stuck with two pieces of expensive junk. Beware also that the faucet is very difficult to install because the mounting screw is only slightly longer than the quart countertop and the mounting pieces provided by the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Beaty

customer_reviews.title: Installed the product and the heating element on the product ...
customer_reviews.text: Installed the product and the heating element on the product was broke. Contacted InSinkErator to see if it could be repaired rather than uninstalled and returned. They mentioned the warranty and how the part may not be covered (mind you it came in the mail broken). Than gave me their local contact for repairing their systems and I have yet to have someone come out, and it has been almost a month. Three times I've gotten a promise of a phone call to schedule service and no one has reached out. Disappointing service and product.
customer_reviews.author: Sheena W.

customer_reviews.title: Breaks in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: I am a tea drinker and this product makes making a cup of tea an easy task. However this particular hot water tank simply stops working (likely from an internal leak) in a year. This is the second tank we have used. The first had a noticeable leak from the bottom and shorted the outlet within a year. Thought it was a faulty piece, so we bought this one. A year later, the electrical keeps on shorting again. What a waste of time, money, and energy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon2012

customer_reviews.title: Button sticks and wont shut off
customer_reviews.text: Very dispointed, worked fir for about 2 and a half months then the button began sticking after limited use. Now I am unable to use it because if I push the button itsticks and wont shut off. I would thing that it should last longer than that for $178 dollars
customer_reviews.author: rg

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but you might need professional help to install
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, but don't believe the claim it can be installed without tools. That would be true if you are only replacing the tank on the same model. If you are doing a new installation of the complete system (tank and dispenser) you will need tools and some plumbing skills. Before you buy this make sure you have unswitched power under the sink within a couple of feet or you will also need electrical wiring skills or an electrician. If you are doing a new installation you may also need to drill through a sink and/or a stone counter top. Neither of which is easy for a beginner DIYer.
customer_reviews.author: TERRY

customer_reviews.title: Best of all the insinkerator models because of the button
customer_reviews.text: Out of all the insinkerator lines this model is the best because of the push button. I liked the models with the levers but in order to turn it on you have to push the lever back. Everyone’s backsplash is a different depth from the unit. When I tried the one with the lever it hit the backsplash before it came on. The button solves that problem. If they were smart they would have made the lever pull Forward to turn it on. Anyway, the button is the safe way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Garden

customer_reviews.title: is there anything better than having hot water instantly
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, is there anything better than having hot water instantly? (No. The answer is "no".). We did not use the faucet as we had one installed already and only needed to replace the tank, but what we did use works perfectly. It's very easy to adjust just how hot you want the water, and it literally comes out hot as soon as you turn it on. It's amazing. I don't want to live in a world where these things don't exist.
customer_reviews.author: ArielZ

customer_reviews.title: Magic
customer_reviews.text: Best kitchen product ever!! The uses for this are endless - instant tea, instant oatmeal, rushed cooking, sterilizing. Also it’s so shiny and beautiful on my counter. I am so proud to have this thing! It’s not the easiest to install because you need to drill a hole in your countertop, but my dad did it easily enough with his own tools. And it doesn’t take up too much space under the sink either. I love it I love it I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: This InSinkErator is absolutely my favorite item in my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This InSinkErator is absolutely my favorite item in my kitchen. No more waiting to boil water. Instant filtered hot water is so gooooood. I bought this one to replace my old one. I had used the old one for 8 years. When it stopped working, I hated boiling water several times a day each time I wanted a cup of tea, coffee or just water for pasta. I actually like this one better than my old one. My old one had a very non ergonomically correct water handle that was very awkward and clumsy to handle. This one has a push button and so easy to use. Great product.!!
customer_reviews.author: Smiley50

customer_reviews.title: Good price - thanks for the price drop!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one, the first lasted for over 4 years before burning out. When replacing the unit, found that the water intake tubing to the water filter was blocked with a calcium build up. Be sure you clear the lines when changing the filter to ensure this doesn't happen. Perhaps it would have lasted longer had we inspected the tubing! I use this unit to make tea (perfect hot temp for brewing!), to sterilize utensils and to add hot water to pots to save cooking time. Couldn't live without it! Best decision I made in my kitchen remodel!
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: great upgrade to kitchen- worth the money
customer_reviews.text: arrived as expected. I put this in because I was remodeling my kitchen and thought it would be a nice little inexpensive upgrade. guests love it especially if they want tea. It is very hot. Also great if you have dishes with grease on them you can run this hot water for a minute two so that you get it off before and it doesn't end up all over your sponge, etc. worth the buy. guests come over and they all want one for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Anissa

customer_reviews.title: Original and replacement leaked continuously within a year
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in November 2017. It started leaking continuously in July 2018. It was under the one-year warranty, so I was able to get it serviced, but I had to work with a specific company and it took them a month to order a replacement and come install it. So new dispenser was installed August/Sept of 2018. Well, guess what.... January 2019, it is leaking continuously again. Customer service says it’s out of warranty and wants me to buy a new one. I didn’t get even one year out of either of the 2 hot water dispensers installed in my home. Fat chance that I’ll be buying another one here. At least not this model.
customer_reviews.author: john M

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Terrific product! I’ve always wanted an instant hot water dispenser- we’re big tea and coffee drinkers in this house. Performs as expected. I have hot water whenever I want it. Yesterday, I had 4 mugs of herbal (no sugar) tea. That’s at least half my daily required water intake. And, it is small enough to fit behind the garbage disposal. A win... Love it!
customer_reviews.author: BikenLisa

customer_reviews.title: It works well. However they all work well for ...
customer_reviews.text: It works well. However they all work well for 2-3 years until they break down. This is my third. I was able to install the first 2 myself. However they decided not to make this one with the compression nut that was supplied with the older models. It cost less than a dollar. I had to drive to home depot and then found out that it didn't slip over the copper pipe. I had to call the plumber and with the installation charge it doubled the price of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Ira Bauman

customer_reviews.title: It's so nice having hot water in an instant
customer_reviews.text: It's so nice having hot water in an instant! We love it for coffee in the am and tea before bed. Works nicely to warm up the dishwater or rinse out coffee to go mugs too. Sometimes when it hasn't run for a bit the faucet splatters hot water out and it hits your hand...It's pretty hot. Never been injured by it, but you can feel it for sure! I also wish it stuck out a bit more so it was easier to get under.
customer_reviews.author: chickadee

customer_reviews.title: not all that great. nice design and good price point but the ...
customer_reviews.text: not all that great. nice design and good price point but the faucet button sticks and the unit dribbles water as a result. There were other reviews that brought up this problem and I should have considered them when making the purchase decision.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Starts leaking alot after a month or so
customer_reviews.text: I give this product a one star because it actually does heat and store water very well. But, I have had to send one back because the seal on the valve button started leaking quite a bit and then just started running out. The company was good enough to send out a replacement. It has now started leaking. Not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: dustynevada

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Works very well but quite loud and operate pretty often. This one replaced my previous insinkerator which lasted about 15 years , and was trouble free ! This new one can't be insulated as well as the old one , probably why its so loud. But, hey , it gets the job done and I am able to enjoy my hot cup of coffee whenever , on demand !
customer_reviews.author: Dana Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Buy the Square Trade warrenty extender
customer_reviews.text: Terrible design on the push-button faucet, but otherwise a good product. We use it all the time and it is so convenient for everything. Luckily, when I bought it, the stories of the button sticking inspired me to get the square trade coverage. Two years after purchase, the button was totally stuck. Filled out the square trade form, money coming my way. I will repurchase the same brand, but with a different faucet type, for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Jakelin

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. Easy to install because it is a replacement for the 10 cup model. The push button faucet is sturdier than the lever; however, I wish the button is on the left side because I'm right handed. Larger pipe dispenses more, faster. This model does not have much boiling noise.
customer_reviews.author: Advid

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the sink!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, especially if you need instant hot water. Thirty years ago, I had one for my baby formula and teas. The only thing that you need to be advised about, is that it works great with a faucet with the holes already there for a soap dispenser for instance. My faucet didn’t have a space for the faucet, so my husband had to cut a hole into the stainless steel sink, which isn’t an easy thing to do. But it worked out great! Very happy for my instant hot water!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica_K

customer_reviews.title: The package is not including all parts that the hot water dispenser installation need.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one InSinkErator Invite H-HOT 100 hot water dispenser in March 2018. It is difficulty to install because the package didn't come with water supply adapter. The installing instruction and video didn't mention this adapter as well. At first, I tried to follow the instruction, it was total failure, then I went to Home Depot for help. The plumber department worker told me that I need one 1/4 adapter valve to connect the water tubing. It took me long time to install this hot water dispenser.
customer_reviews.author: Florence Lin

customer_reviews.title: Great for 1.5 years
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item 2 years ago. Installation was more complicated than I thought, as I needed both a plumber and an electrician to complete the job. The unit lasted 1.5 years until it started dripping continuously. Had to shut it down a few months ago, right as Covid was hitting so I've been without my easy hot water for a long time. :( Not sure if I need an entire new unit or just the faucet, or maybe it's just a washer, but I anticipated a much longer period of functionality. I'm nervous about buying another InSinkErator, but might try the one with a lever next. When it works, it's great and so convenient!
customer_reviews.author: skf421

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation, produces very hot water
customer_reviews.text: The unit mounts very easily and connections are easy to make. Took no time to install and get working. I have the temperature controller set to mid-scale and get very hot water. Quite happy with the unit. It was a replacement for another similar unit that was 15 years old.
customer_reviews.author: William H.

customer_reviews.title: INSINKERATOR DOESN"T TRUST AMAZON RECEIPTS
customer_reviews.text: Came highly recommended. If it performed as promised I'd give it a higher rating. I've had to perform maintenance on it several times since plumber installed it in September. Today I was on with support (temperature won't rise above 150) for 23 minutes to learn Service Agency won't accept Amazon Receipts as bona fide and instead I need to send details to @emerson for approval. More to follow.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Did not last
customer_reviews.text: This product has failed just beyond the 1-yr warrantee period. I bought this is August 2018 and October 2019 it barely warms the water. It worked great while it did but now I can wash my hands in the 'hot' water stream with no danger. Thermostat is at max. I can't replace these units every year. I give it w stars for easy install and use and the fact that it did work but it's not worth it if I have to replace every year.
customer_reviews.author: Glen G.

customer_reviews.title: Pure junk
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoyed this unit... for the one week that we could use it. The faucet leaks... no, it runs constantly. To the point that we have unplugged it and disconnected the water supply to it. Now it is nothing more than something to plug the hole in our sink. Sure, I can remove it and probably return it, but why... only to do it all again a week or so after installing the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: j. hielscher

customer_reviews.title: I love the instant hot water but the faucet on this unit is poor quality
customer_reviews.text: We remolded our kitchen in 2017, adding this unit. The faucet portion broke, with the button sticking in the on position. Troubleshooting by a handy husband didn't work and the warranty is only 1 year. So, we purchased an entire second unit to replace the faucet as they don't sell it independently. 18 months later and the faucet is broken again in the same way, again out of their short warranty for a plumbing fixture that should definitely last longer than a year. I'm on the hunt for a different product, but insinkerator has a bit of a monopoly for instant hot water.
customer_reviews.author: MamaJoy

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy the push button type!
customer_reviews.text: Had this installed in April when my kitchen was updated. Right away the button was sticking. It got worse. 6 months later the button will not release at all. Went to Lowes to find a replacement for the faucet only which they did not have in stock. The person helping me said that these are known for the button sitcking. I chose a different faucet. The tank works great, just don't buy the push button one.
customer_reviews.author: Sebenart

customer_reviews.title: FYI - This is amazing! BUT the push button can be frustrating when ...
customer_reviews.text: FYI - This is amazing! BUT the push button can be frustrating when trying to hold a pot and fill it. I got the push button because I have kids and they can't accidentally turn it on and burn themselves. If you do not have kids - If they have it - would recommend one that has a handle that you can push on and leave on for ease of filling up pots, etc.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: "Indispensable" :)
customer_reviews.text: Many uses, including pre-heating dinner dishes and pre-rinsing them afterward for delayed hand washing. This purchase replaced an older InSinkErator, so the existing (better) countertop faucet remained in place. Just snapped lines together and it was ready. New unit seems quieter than old unit, both in dispensing and in heating mode.
customer_reviews.author: calart

customer_reviews.title: Easy install
customer_reviews.text: Nice part Easy install Not to worry about the button sticking lightly dusted it with some tri-flow MAKE SURE TO BUY A 1/4 compression ferrule and nut if you are removing another system. This unit does NOT come with
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Varn Harper

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic instant  hot water for coffee/tea
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! This is the second unit we’ve bought. These things are one of those purchases where you go “I should have bought one of these years ago”. The novelty of having fresh piping hot water never gets old. We supply water to this unit with our reverse osmosis drinking water and get crystal clear, boiling hot water for tea, coffee, and cooking. Highly recommend these things
customer_reviews.author: Jeni

customer_reviews.title: Drippy faucet
customer_reviews.text: We don't use this a lot, but when we do, it's great to have. Having said that, after less than a year of very light use, the faucet drips. Actually, it simply runs at a steady stream at times. Have to fiddle with the button in HOPES that it stops. Poor poor quality. A shame.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Henry

customer_reviews.title: Like it, see how the mechanism holds up.
customer_reviews.text: This is the most used appliance in the kitchen, and I missed it after the lever wore out after 11-12 years of heavy use. We’ll see how durable the push button mechanism lasts. Good flow and no problems keeping my arms away.
customer_reviews.author: M. Muilenburg

customer_reviews.title: Took 3 to Get One That Worked
customer_reviews.text: These aren't great. They aren't well-made, but once you work through the kinks, they work great for a while. We installed 2 (plumber expense). One leaked, the other didn't flow. The third one worked fine. I like it, but what a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Clark

customer_reviews.title: Button not the best design
customer_reviews.text: We love having instant hot water, and this is as hot as you want it. I wish the button was on the left instead of the right, or that I’d ordered one with a handle or knob in the middle, but we’ve gotten used to it.
customer_reviews.author: jerry scott

customer_reviews.title: Great design and function
customer_reviews.text: Had one at old house and couldn’t do without it when we moved. This model is push button instead of the lever we had before and we like it better. The lever one makes you get your hand too close to the dispensing pipe and often means you get burned while dispensing. This is a much better design and it’s much less expensive too.
customer_reviews.author: TBLong

customer_reviews.title: Dispenser button sticks
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of these I've purchased. The first one lasted 2.5 years before the dispenser button began to stick in the on position. It was replaced with the same model purchased on Amazon. The button began to stick, after not even a year of use on the new unit. It turns on by it's self randomly. It's wasting water, energy, and is a possible danger to anyone who's hands might be in the way when he takes on a life of its own. I'm replacing it with a lever type dispenser.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Casey

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT AND EASY INSTALLATION
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install except for the trip to HD for a 1/4 inch farrell for the copper line. In all fareness, if I was installing a new valve, it would have been included. Installation was less than an hour including removal and reinstalling the garbage disposal for easier access and removal of old system. I installed this for my parents in there kitchen and will be installing in my house later this year, and possibly bathrooms, this is awesome hot water NOW!!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Oelkers

customer_reviews.title: Fast, hot water.
customer_reviews.text: Love having instant hot water. Have had an InSinkErator for more than 20 years. Don't care for the "dummy" button on the right, it's just not very ergonomic for a right handed user. Much preferred the ones with a lever. We know these appliances are life limited, this is our 3rd unit.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Anne J. Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Not installed yet but had one in previous house. They do what they are meant to do ... Provide instant hot water. Only problem is that they start leaking after a year or so but InSinkErator replaced the tank three times free of charge.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this product
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this faucet model. Installed in December and now in March the button sticks and won’t turn off. This is a consistent comment and will happen to you. Don’t buy the model with a push button.
customer_reviews.author: JC in DC

customer_reviews.title: All plastic
customer_reviews.text: Defective unit, returned. All plastic, no stainless steel part. Will not last. Size is small and design is the best. Faucet design is ugly. I gave 3 stars due to the small size of the hot water tank
customer_reviews.author: YUGIOH

customer_reviews.title: Finally, safer spout
customer_reviews.text: This is my third install of a Insta-hot. Finally, there is a longer supply tubing. With Disposal, remote sink cable, controller for auto faucets, soap dispensers, it gets quite crowded. Also, remember the possibility conflict of spacing on your sink deck.
customer_reviews.author: Stinkey

customer_reviews.title: That's really what I bought it for and it works beautifully within its purpose
customer_reviews.text: Installed this model after an older model kicked the bucket. The older model was an all steel/aluminum jobby and I was skeptical about the plastic design but it has outperformed my doubts. Water is hotter than the older model and seems to heat up faster. That's really what I bought it for and it works beautifully within its purpose. The only negative i have: I really wish I didn't have to pay for hardware that I already have - can't a base model be sold that is JUST the tank? I don't need more faucet hardware.
customer_reviews.author: CastleRanch

customer_reviews.title: Does not have everything you need to install!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This DOES NOT come with compression nut and sleeve you WILL NEED to install it. This is beyond stupid. Like selling a car with no way to fill the gas tank. The two pieces cost me less than $1, but it took me an hour of driving to get them. I will probably NEVER buy anything from insinkerator again because of this.
customer_reviews.author: Henry D.

customer_reviews.title: Water lines too short, impossible to install
customer_reviews.text: Water lines too short.... how do you expect someone to install it, we wasted lot of time in lowes and home depot to find water line extensions but couldn’t find it. Its impossible to install unless your kitchen doesn’t have sink.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing durability- need to replace way too soon
customer_reviews.text: Malfunctioned after 2 years of very light useage. Warranty was only one year, and all tha the manufacturer offered me is 35% off a new new unit purchased direct from them at full, non-discounted price. Since the labor to install this is quite expensive, I’m screwed. I will look to buy a higher quality unit from a different manufacturer
customer_reviews.author: Laserson

customer_reviews.title: Had to return as the space I was replacing my ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to return as the space I was replacing my old one was too small to fit this one and I didn't have an alternative site under my sink where the hoses would reach. This is not an assessment of performance - just be aware this is a bit larger than their model from 2007.
customer_reviews.author: Boomer56

customer_reviews.title: Poor design, button sticks
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install however we’ve only had this a little over a year and the button sticks, the only way to stop the steady stream of hot water is to shut it off at the valve. Tried troubleshooting to get it unstuck but to no avail. Unfortunately we need to get a new one. Will JR be buying this model or any model with buttons. Poor design
customer_reviews.author: Dave Hill

customer_reviews.title: It drips
customer_reviews.text: As professional installed but dripped. Purchased they Amazon Warehouse. It was defective. Returning and getting from Home Depot. The water was VERY hot. I wouldn’t have it around kids.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Diva

customer_reviews.title: The color and finish matches the faucet perfectly and works as advertised.  Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the color and finish. We use it primarily for hot tea and instant breakfasts (oatmeal and grits). Also when a recipe calls for hot water as an ingredient.
customer_reviews.author: Edmund E Moore

customer_reviews.title: Really a luxury item, awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Copper line needs to be longer, had to cut existing copper and make house line higher to allow for short copper pipe that came with unit. Also the nut and flair doesn’t come with kit, come on, it can’t be just a few cents to add them, I only paid 2 bucks to get 3 of each. Having said that, it works awesome, some have said it is loud, but you can’t hear mine at all. Great performance!!!
customer_reviews.author: Darrell E Helton

customer_reviews.title: it an excellent appliance.
